content.description: Climb the overhanging gold rock to the left of legacy.  Pull a roof on a big pocket and step up onto the slab above.
content.location: Left of Legacy.  Furthest bolt line right in the gold/orange rock cave.

content.description: Climb onto a ledge left of the fist bolt. Stem across the interesting moves past the second bolt and find a stance to clip the third.  Now it's on, steeper pumpy moves on large underclings and side pulls allow a pull onto the slab above.  Technical moves finish the route on a jug near the chains.
content.location: Second to last climb on the Cascade Wall.  Just downhill of Legacy.

content.description: Climb up to a small ledge.  From here crank a large pocket and some good feet to gain the left arete using some side pulls.  Move up the steepening face into a compression move.  Move right to a pumpy rest and continue to pull good pockets and technical slab to the chains.
content.location: 3rd to last route before the arete hosting the Log Wall climbs.  Look for the cave with the overhanging route.

content.description: Balance gets you through the start, hard cranking on sharp holds at the steeper crux, with some mossy, needly slab at the finish. Solid climb for the grade.
content.location: If looking at Legacy, this is the first route on the “outside” of the cave to the left.

content.description: Climb the orange face over a line of bolts, or use a seam to the left.  Negotiate the overhanging fin and pull to the anchors.
content.location: Downhill of Labyrinth in the orange cave.

content.description: Start same as Night Hunter.  At the 3rd bolt rest, move right into the crux of the route and "scamper" through the big holds that follow to another move at the grade right before the anchors.
content.location: Last route on the downhill side of the Cascade Wall.  According to Bill Newcomb, the route was completed and FFA'ed on the day of a blue moon, hence the name.

content.description: Alleged "best 5.9 in the crag''. Climb the 5.12 route below and finish for some 5.9 fun, or rap from the top of the block to climb from the midpoint anchors.
Steeper gold/brown rock, hosting some great powerful climbs as well as a few moderates.  Home of the classic Southern Oregon 5.12 Legacy.
